p: Because of the negative effects of common molluscicides in humans and other non-target organisms [ 7], new effective and environmentally friendly control methods are investigated. Some of them as mechanical barriers (diatomaceous earth, hydrated lime, sulfur, fumed silica, wood ash) are quite effective but insufficient in humid weather conditions when soil moisture adversely affects the efficacy of barrier materials [ 8, 9]. Others, such as nematode Phasmarhabditis hermaphrodita, are commercialized for biocontrol applications, but have been shown to be less capable of killing adult Arion sp. [ 10, 11] Bioactive compounds derived from different plant species are the new niche where new active ingredients for molluscicides are sought and even invasive plants can be used successfully [ 12].
